text: XLVIII .
text_tokenized: XLVIII .

text: The whole party were in hopes of a letter from Mr. Bennet the next morning , but the post came in without bringing a single line from him .
text_tokenized: The whole party were in hopes of a letter from Mr. Bennet the next morning , but the post came in without bringing a single line from him .

text: His family knew him to be , on all common occasions , a most negligent and dilatory correspondent ; but at such a time they had hoped for exertion .
text_tokenized: His family knew him to be , on all common occasions , a most negligent and dilatory correspondent ; but at such a time they had hoped for exertion .

text: They were forced to conclude , that he had no pleasing intelligence to send ; but even of _ that _ they would have been glad to be certain .
text_tokenized: They were forced to conclude , that he had no pleasing intelligence to send ; but even of _ that _ they would have been glad to be certain .

text: Mr. Gardiner had waited only for the letters before he set off .
text_tokenized: Mr. Gardiner had waited only for the letters before he set off .

text: When he was gone , they were certain at least of receiving constant information of what was going on ; and their uncle promised , at parting , to prevail on Mr. Bennet to return to Longbourn as soon as he could , to the great consolation of his sister , who considered it as the only security for her husband ’s not being killed in a duel .
text_tokenized: When he was gone , they were certain at least of receiving constant information of what was going on ; and their uncle promised , at parting , to prevail on Mr. Bennet to return to Longbourn as soon as he could , to the great consolation of his sister , who considered it as the only security for her husband ’s not being killed in a duel .

text: Mrs. Gardiner and the children were to remain in Hertfordshire a few days longer , as the former thought her presence might be serviceable to her nieces .
text_tokenized: Mrs. Gardiner and the children were to remain in Hertfordshire a few days longer , as the former thought her presence might be serviceable to her nieces .

text: She shared in their attendance on Mrs. Bennet , and was a great comfort to them in their hours of freedom .
text_tokenized: She shared in their attendance on Mrs. Bennet , and was a great comfort to them in their hours of freedom .

text: Their other aunt also visited them frequently , and always , as she said , with the design of cheering and heartening them up -- though , as she never came without reporting some fresh instance of Wickham ’s extravagance or irregularity , she seldom went away without leaving them more dispirited than she found them .
text_tokenized: Their other aunt also visited them frequently , and always , as she said , with the design of cheering and heartening them up -- though , as she never came without reporting some fresh instance of Wickham ’s extravagance or irregularity , she seldom went away without leaving them more dispirited than she found them .

text: All Meryton seemed striving to blacken the man who , but three months before , had been almost an angel of light .
text_tokenized: All Meryton seemed striving to blacken the man who , but three months before , had been almost an angel of light .

text: He was declared to be in debt to every tradesman in the place , and his intrigues , all honoured with the title of seduction ,
text_tokenized: He was declared to be in debt to every tradesman in the place , and his intrigues , all honoured with the title of seduction ,

text: had been extended into every tradesman ’s family .
text_tokenized: had been extended into every tradesman ’s family .

text: Everybody declared that he was the wickedest young man in the world ; and everybody began to find out that they had always distrusted the appearance of his goodness .
text_tokenized: Everybody declared that he was the wickedest young man in the world ; and everybody began to find out that they had always distrusted the appearance of his goodness .

text: Elizabeth , though she did not credit above half of what was said , believed enough to make her former assurance of her sister ’s ruin still more certain ; and even Jane , who believed still less of it , became almost hopeless , more especially as the time was now come , when , if they had gone to Scotland , which she had never before entirely despaired of , they must in all probability have gained some news of them .
text_tokenized: Elizabeth , though she did not credit above half of what was said , believed enough to make her former assurance of her sister ’s ruin still more certain ; and even Jane , who believed still less of it , became almost hopeless , more especially as the time was now come , when , if they had gone to Scotland , which she had never before entirely despaired of , they must in all probability have gained some news of them .

text: Mr. Gardiner left Longbourn on Sunday ; on Tuesday , his wife received a letter from him : it told them , that on his arrival he had immediately found out his brother , and persuaded him to come to Gracechurch Street . That Mr. Bennet had been to Epsom and Clapham , before his arrival , but without gaining any satisfactory information ; and that he was now determined to inquire at all the principal hotels in town , as Mr. Bennet thought it possible they might have gone to one of them , on their first coming to London , before they procured lodgings .
text_tokenized: Mr. Gardiner left Longbourn on Sunday ; on Tuesday , his wife received a letter from him : it told them , that on his arrival he had immediately found out his brother , and persuaded him to come to Gracechurch Street . That Mr. Bennet had been to Epsom and Clapham , before his arrival , but without gaining any satisfactory information ; and that he was now determined to inquire at all the principal hotels in town , as Mr. Bennet thought it possible they might have gone to one of them , on their first coming to London , before they procured lodgings .

text: Mr. Gardiner himself did not expect any success from this measure ; but as his brother was eager in it , he meant to assist him in pursuing it .
text_tokenized: Mr. Gardiner himself did not expect any success from this measure ; but as his brother was eager in it , he meant to assist him in pursuing it .

text: He added , that Mr. Bennet seemed wholly disinclined at present to leave London , and promised to write again very soon .
text_tokenized: He added , that Mr. Bennet seemed wholly disinclined at present to leave London , and promised to write again very soon .

text: There was also a postscript to this effect:-- “ I have written to Colonel Forster to desire him to find out , if possible , from some of the young man ’s intimates in the regiment , whether Wickham has any relations or connections who would be likely to know in what part of the town he has now concealed himself .

text: If there were anyone that one could apply to , with a probability of gaining such a clue as that , it might be of essential consequence .

text_tokenized: At present we have nothing to guide us .

text_tokenized: Colonel Forster will , I dare say ,

text_tokenized: do everything in his power to satisfy us on this head .

text: But , on second thoughts , perhaps Lizzy could tell us what relations he has now living better than any other person .
text_tokenized: But , on second thoughts , perhaps Lizzy could tell us what relations he has now living better than any other person .

text: Elizabeth was at no loss to understand from whence this deference for her authority proceeded ; but it was not in her power to give any information of so satisfactory a nature as the compliment deserved .
text_tokenized: Elizabeth was at no loss to understand from whence this deference for her authority proceeded ; but it was not in her power to give any information of so satisfactory a nature as the compliment deserved .

text: She had never heard of his having had any relations , except a father and mother , both of whom had been dead many years .
text_tokenized: She had never heard of his having had any relations , except a father and mother , both of whom had been dead many years .

text: It was possible , however , that some of his companions in the ----shire might be able to give more information ; and though she was not very sanguine in expecting it , the application was a something to look forward to .
text_tokenized: It was possible , however , that some of his companions in the ----shire might be able to give more information ; and though she was not very sanguine in expecting it , the application was a something to look forward to .

text: Every day at Longbourn was now a day of anxiety ; but the most anxious part of each was when the post was expected .
text_tokenized: Every day at Longbourn was now a day of anxiety ; but the most anxious part of each was when the post was expected .

text: The arrival of letters was the first grand object of every morning ’s impatience .
text_tokenized: The arrival of letters was the first grand object of every morning ’s impatience .

text: Through letters , whatever of good or bad was to be told would be communicated ; and every succeeding day was expected to bring some news of importance .
text_tokenized: Through letters , whatever of good or bad was to be told would be communicated ; and every succeeding day was expected to bring some news of importance .

text: But before they heard again from Mr. Gardiner , a letter arrived for their father , from a different quarter , from Mr. Collins ; which , as Jane had received directions to open all that came for him in his absence , she accordingly read ; and Elizabeth , who knew what curiosities his letters always were , looked over her , and read it likewise .
text_tokenized: But before they heard again from Mr. Gardiner , a letter arrived for their father , from a different quarter , from Mr. Collins ; which , as Jane had received directions to open all that came for him in his absence , she accordingly read ; and Elizabeth , who knew what curiosities his letters always were , looked over her , and read it likewise .

text: It was as follows:-- / * “ My dear Sir , * / “ I feel myself called upon , by our relationship , and my situation in life , to condole with you on the grievous affliction you are now suffering under , of which we were yesterday informed by a letter from Hertfordshire .
text_tokenized: It was as follows:-- / * “ My dear Sir , * / “ I feel myself called upon , by our relationship , and my situation in life , to condole with you on the grievous affliction you are now suffering under , of which we were yesterday informed by a letter from Hertfordshire .

text: Be assured , my dear sir , that Mrs. Collins and myself sincerely sympathize with you , and all your respectable family , in your present distress , which must be of the bitterest kind , because proceeding from a cause which no time can remove .
text_tokenized: Be assured , my dear sir , that Mrs. Collins and myself sincerely sympathize with you , and all your respectable family , in your present distress , which must be of the bitterest kind , because proceeding from a cause which no time can remove .

text: No arguments shall be wanting on my part , that can alleviate so severe a misfortune ; or that may comfort you , under a circumstance that must be , of all others , most afflicting to a parent ’s mind .
text_tokenized: No arguments shall be wanting on my part , that can alleviate so severe a misfortune ; or that may comfort you , under a circumstance that must be , of all others , most afflicting to a parent ’s mind .

text: The death of your daughter would have been a blessing in comparison of this .
text_tokenized: The death of your daughter would have been a blessing in comparison of this .

text: And it is the more to be lamented , because there is reason to suppose , as my dear Charlotte informs me , that this licentiousness of behaviour in your daughter has proceeded from a faulty degree of indulgence ; though , at the same time , for the consolation of yourself and Mrs. Bennet , I am inclined to think that her own disposition must be naturally bad , or she could not be guilty of such an enormity , at so early an age . Howsoever that may be , you are grievously to be pitied ; in which opinion I am not only joined by Mrs. Collins , but likewise by Lady Catherine and her daughter , to whom I have related the affair .
text_tokenized: And it is the more to be lamented , because there is reason to suppose , as my dear Charlotte informs me , that this licentiousness of behaviour in your daughter has proceeded from a faulty degree of indulgence ; though , at the same time , for the consolation of yourself and Mrs. Bennet , I am inclined to think that her own disposition must be naturally bad , or she could not be guilty of such an enormity , at so early an age . Howsoever that may be , you are grievously to be pitied ; in which opinion I am not only joined by Mrs. Collins , but likewise by Lady Catherine and her daughter , to whom I have related the affair .

text: They agree with me in apprehending that this false step in one daughter will be injurious to the fortunes of all the others : for who , as Lady Catherine herself condescendingly says , will connect themselves with such a family ?
text_tokenized: They agree with me in apprehending that this false step in one daughter will be injurious to the fortunes of all the others : for who , as Lady Catherine herself condescendingly says , will connect themselves with such a family ?

text: And this consideration leads me , moreover , to reflect , with augmented satisfaction , on a certain event of last November ; for had it been otherwise , I must have been involved in all your sorrow and disgrace .
text_tokenized: And this consideration leads me , moreover , to reflect , with augmented satisfaction , on a certain event of last November ; for had it been otherwise , I must have been involved in all your sorrow and disgrace .

text: Let me advise you , then , my dear sir , to console yourself as much as possible , to throw off your unworthy child from your affection for ever , and leave her to reap the fruits of her own heinous offence .
text_tokenized: Let me advise you , then , my dear sir , to console yourself as much as possible , to throw off your unworthy child from your affection for ever , and leave her to reap the fruits of her own heinous offence .

text: “ I am , dear sir , ” etc . , etc .
text_tokenized: “ I am , dear sir , ” etc . , etc .

text: Mr. Gardiner did not write again , till he had received an answer from Colonel Forster ; and then he had nothing of a pleasant nature to send .
text_tokenized: Mr. Gardiner did not write again , till he had received an answer from Colonel Forster ; and then he had nothing of a pleasant nature to send .

text: It was not known that Wickham had a single relation with whom he kept up any connection , and it was certain that he had no near one living .
text_tokenized: It was not known that Wickham had a single relation with whom he kept up any connection , and it was certain that he had no near one living .

text: His former acquaintance had been numerous ; but since he had been in the militia , it did not appear that he was on terms of particular friendship with any of them .
text_tokenized: His former acquaintance had been numerous ; but since he had been in the militia , it did not appear that he was on terms of particular friendship with any of them .

text: There was no one , therefore , who could be pointed out as likely to give any news of him .
text_tokenized: There was no one , therefore , who could be pointed out as likely to give any news of him .

text: And in the wretched state of his own finances , there was a very powerful motive for secrecy , in addition to his fear of discovery by Lydia ’s relations ; for it had just transpired that he had left gaming debts behind him to a very considerable amount .
text_tokenized: And in the wretched state of his own finances , there was a very powerful motive for secrecy , in addition to his fear of discovery by Lydia ’s relations ; for it had just transpired that he had left gaming debts behind him to a very considerable amount .

text: Colonel Forster believed that more than a thousand pounds would be necessary to clear his expenses at Brighton .
text_tokenized: Colonel Forster believed that more than a thousand pounds would be necessary to clear his expenses at Brighton .

text: He owed a good deal in the town , but his debts of honour were still more formidable .
text_tokenized: He owed a good deal in the town , but his debts of honour were still more formidable .

text: Mr. Gardiner did not attempt to conceal these particulars from the Longbourn family ; Jane heard them with horror .
text_tokenized: Mr. Gardiner did not attempt to conceal these particulars from the Longbourn family ; Jane heard them with horror .

text: “ This is wholly unexpected ; I had not an idea of it .
text_tokenized: “ This is wholly unexpected ; I had not an idea of it .

text: Mr. Gardiner added , in his letter , that they might expect to see their father at home on the following day , which was Saturday .
text_tokenized: Mr. Gardiner added , in his letter , that they might expect to see their father at home on the following day , which was Saturday .

text: Rendered spiritless by the ill success of all their endeavours , he had yielded to his brother - in - law ’s entreaty that he would return to his family and leave it to him to do whatever occasion might suggest to be advisable for continuing their pursuit .

text: Mrs. Gardiner went away in all the perplexity about Elizabeth and her Derbyshire friend , that had attended her from that part of the world .

text: The present unhappy state of the family rendered any other excuse for the lowness of her spirits unnecessary ; nothing , therefore , could be fairly conjectured from _ that_,--though Elizabeth , who was by this time tolerably well acquainted with her own feelings , was perfectly aware that , had she known nothing of Darcy , she could have borne the dread of Lydia ’s infamy somewhat better . It would have spared her , she thought , one sleepless night out of two .

It would have spared her , she thought , one sleepless night out of two .

text: When Mr. Bennet arrived , he had all the appearance of his usual philosophic composure .
text_tokenized: When Mr. Bennet arrived , he had all the appearance of his usual philosophic composure .

text: He said as little as he had ever been in the habit of saying ; made no mention of the business that had taken him away ; and it was some time before his daughters had courage to speak of it .
text_tokenized: He said as little as he had ever been in the habit of saying ; made no mention of the business that had taken him away ; and it was some time before his daughters had courage to speak of it .

text: It was not till the afternoon , when he joined them at tea , that Elizabeth ventured to introduce the subject ; and then , on her briefly expressing her sorrow for what he must have endured , he replied , “ Say nothing of that .
text_tokenized: It was not till the afternoon , when he joined them at tea , that Elizabeth ventured to introduce the subject ; and then , on her briefly expressing her sorrow for what he must have endured , he replied , “ Say nothing of that .

text: Who should suffer but myself ?
text_tokenized: Who should suffer but myself ?

text: It has been my own doing , and I ought to feel it . ”
text_tokenized: It has been my own doing , and I ought to feel it . ”

text: “ You must not be too severe upon yourself , ” replied Elizabeth .
text_tokenized: “ You must not be too severe upon yourself , ” replied Elizabeth .

text: “ You may well warn me against such an evil .
text_tokenized: “ You may well warn me against such an evil .

text: Human nature is so prone to fall into it !
text_tokenized: Human nature is so prone to fall into it !

text: No , Lizzy , let me once in my life feel how much I have been to blame .
text_tokenized: No , Lizzy , let me once in my life feel how much I have been to blame .

text: I am not afraid of being overpowered by the impression .
text_tokenized: I am not afraid of being overpowered by the impression .

text: It will pass away soon enough . ” “ Do you suppose them to be in London ? ” “ Yes ; where else can they be so well concealed ? ” “ And Lydia used to want to go to London , ” added Kitty .
text_tokenized: It will pass away soon enough . ” “ Do you suppose them to be in London ? ” “ Yes ; where else can they be so well concealed ? ” “ And Lydia used to want to go to London , ” added Kitty .

text: “ She is happy , then , ” said her father , drily ; “ and her residence there will probably be of some duration .
text_tokenized: “ She is happy , then , ” said her father , drily ; “ and her residence there will probably be of some duration .

text: Then , after a short silence , he continued , “ Lizzy , I bear you no ill - will for being justified in your advice to me last May , which , considering the event , shows some greatness of mind . ”
text_tokenized: Then , after a short silence , he continued , “ Lizzy , I bear you no ill - will for being justified in your advice to me last May , which , considering the event , shows some greatness of mind . ”

text: Another day I will do the same ; I will sit in my library , in my nightcap and powdering gown , and give as much trouble as I can,--or perhaps I may defer it till Kitty runs away . ” “ I am not going to run away , papa , ” said Kitty , fretfully .

text_tokenized: “ If _ I _ should ever go to Brighton , I would behave better than Lydia . ”

text: I would not trust you so near it as Eastbourne , for fifty pounds !
text_tokenized: I would not trust you so near it as Eastbourne , for fifty pounds !

text: No , Kitty , I have at least learnt to be cautious , and you will feel the effects of it .
text_tokenized: No , Kitty , I have at least learnt to be cautious , and you will feel the effects of it .

text: No officer is ever to enter my house again , nor even to pass through the village .
text_tokenized: No officer is ever to enter my house again , nor even to pass through the village .

text: Balls will be absolutely prohibited , unless you stand up with one of your sisters .
text_tokenized: Balls will be absolutely prohibited , unless you stand up with one of your sisters .

text: And you are never to stir out of doors , till you can prove that you have spent ten minutes of every day in a rational manner .
text_tokenized: And you are never to stir out of doors , till you can prove that you have spent ten minutes of every day in a rational manner .

text: “ Well , well , ” said he , “ do not make yourself unhappy .

text: If you are a good girl for the next ten years , I will take you to a review at the end of them . ”

text: XLIX .
text_tokenized: XLIX .

text: Two days after Mr. Bennet ’s return , as Jane and Elizabeth were walking together in the shrubbery behind the house , they saw the housekeeper coming towards them , and concluding that she came to call them to their mother , went forward to meet her ; but instead of the expected summons , when they approached her , she said to Miss Bennet , “ I beg your pardon , madam , for interrupting you , but I was in hopes you might have got some good news from town , so I took the liberty of coming to ask . ”
text_tokenized: Two days after Mr. Bennet ’s return , as Jane and Elizabeth were walking together in the shrubbery behind the house , they saw the housekeeper coming towards them , and concluding that she came to call them to their mother , went forward to meet her ; but instead of the expected summons , when they approached her , she said to Miss Bennet , “ I beg your pardon , madam , for interrupting you , but I was in hopes you might have got some good news from town , so I took the liberty of coming to ask . ”

text: “ What do you mean , Hill ?
text_tokenized: “ What do you mean , Hill ?

text: We have heard nothing from town . ”
text_tokenized: We have heard nothing from town . ”

text: “ Dear madam , ” cried Mrs. Hill , in great astonishment , “ do n’t you know there is an express come for master from Mr. Gardiner ?
text_tokenized: “ Dear madam , ” cried Mrs. Hill , in great astonishment , “ do n’t you know there is an express come for master from Mr. Gardiner ?

text: He has been here this half hour , and master has had a letter . ”
text_tokenized: He has been here this half hour , and master has had a letter . ”

text: Away ran the girls , too eager to get in to have time for speech .

text: They ran through the vestibule into the breakfast - room ; from thence to the library;--their father was in neither ; and they were on the point of seeking him upstairs with their mother , when they were met by the butler , who said,-- “ If you are looking for my master , ma’am , he is walking towards the little copse .

text: All that is required of you is , to assure to your daughter , by settlement , her equal share of the five thousand pounds , secured among your children after the decease of yourself and my sister ; and , moreover , to enter into an engagement of allowing her , during your life , one hundred pounds per annum .
text_tokenized: All that is required of you is , to assure to your daughter , by settlement , her equal share of the five thousand pounds , secured among your children after the decease of yourself and my sister ; and , moreover , to enter into an engagement of allowing her , during your life , one hundred pounds per annum .

text: These are conditions which , considering everything , I had no hesitation in complying with , as far as I thought myself privileged , for you .
text_tokenized: These are conditions which , considering everything , I had no hesitation in complying with , as far as I thought myself privileged , for you .

text: I shall send this by express , that no time may be lost in bringing me your answer .
text_tokenized: I shall send this by express , that no time may be lost in bringing me your answer .

text: You will easily comprehend , from these particulars , that Mr. Wickham ’s circumstances are not so hopeless as they are generally believed to be .
text_tokenized: You will easily comprehend , from these particulars , that Mr. Wickham ’s circumstances are not so hopeless as they are generally believed to be .

text: The world has been deceived in that respect ; and I am happy to say , there will be some little money , even when all his debts are discharged , to settle on my niece , in addition to her own fortune .
text_tokenized: The world has been deceived in that respect ; and I am happy to say , there will be some little money , even when all his debts are discharged , to settle on my niece , in addition to her own fortune .

text: If , as I conclude will be the case , you send me full powers to act in your name throughout the whole of this business , I will immediately give directions to Haggerston for preparing a proper settlement .
text_tokenized: If , as I conclude will be the case , you send me full powers to act in your name throughout the whole of this business , I will immediately give directions to Haggerston for preparing a proper settlement .

text: There will not be the smallest occasion for your coming to town again ; therefore stay quietly at Longbourn , and depend on my diligence and care .
text_tokenized: There will not be the smallest occasion for your coming to town again ; therefore stay quietly at Longbourn , and depend on my diligence and care .

text: Send back your answer as soon as you can , and be careful to write explicitly .
